snippet: For 4,200 hungry, scared people whose ship limped into dock Thursday, an ordeal was finally ending. For Carnival Cruise Lines, the work was just beginning.
abstract: Carnival Cruise Lines ship Triumph docks in Mobile, Ala, ending five-day ordeal for 4,200 passengers and crew who were stranded without power in Gulf of Mexico after engine room fire disabled ship; company faces public relations nightmare and possibility of legal actions from passengers.

byline.original: By ROBBIE BROWN, KIM SEVERSON and BARRY MEIER
byline.contributor: Robbie Brown reported from Mobile, Kim Severson from Atlanta, and Barry Meier from New York. Marc Santora contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: For 4,200 hungry, scared people whose ship limped into dock Thursday, an ordeal was finally ending. For Carnival Cruise Lines, the work was just beginning.

headline.main: Cruise Line’s Woes Are Far From Over as Ship Makes Port
headline.print_headline: Cruise Line’s Woes Are Far From Over As Ship Makes Port
